Wisdom: الْعُلَمَاءُ أَطْهَرُ النَّاسِ أَخْلَاقاً وَأَقَلُّهُمْ فِي الْمَطَامِعِ أَعْرَاقاً
enWisdom: Scholars are the purest of people in character and the least rooted in [vain] desires

Wisdom: ثَمَرَةُ الْمَعْرِفَةِ الْعُزُوفُ عَنْ دَارِ الْفَنَاءِ
enWisdom: The fruit of cognizance is becoming averse to the evanescent abode

Wisdom: رَأْسُ الْعِلْمِ التَّمْيِيزُ بَيْنَ الْأَخْلَاقِ وَإِظْهَارُ مَحْمُودِهَا وَقَمْعُ مَذْمُومِهَا
enWisdom: The pinnacle of knowledge is distinguishing between character traits, manifesting the praiseworthy among them and suppressing the blameworthy among them
The perfection of knowledge is forbearance, and the perfection of forbearance is increased tolerance and suppression [of anger]

Wisdom: لِلنُّفُوسِ طَبَائِعُ سُوءٍ وَالْحِكْمَةُ تَنْهَى عَنْهَا
enWisdom: The souls have certain evil natures [and characteristics] and wisdom forbids [one from] them

Wisdom: لَوْ عَرَفَ الْمَنْقُوصُ نَقْصَهُ لَسَاءَهُ مَا يَرَى مِنْ عَيْبِهِ
enWisdom: If the deficient person came to know of his own deficiency, he would be greatly disturbed by what he learnt of his faults

Wisdom: لَوْ لَمْ يَنْهَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ عَنْ مَحَارِمِهِ لَوَجَبَ أَنْ يَجْتَنِبَهَا الْعَاقِلُ
enWisdom: Rejoicing in vices is uglier than committing them
One who is cognizant, refrains [from the forbidden]

Wisdom: يَسِيرُ الْمَعْرِفَةِ يُوجِبُ الزُّهْدَ فِي الدُّنْيَا
enWisdom: The smallest amount of cognizance leads to disinclination towards worldly pleasures
